header.gameNote: HOOPS FOR HOPE CLASSIC AT PUERTO VALLARTA MEXICO

article.headline: South Carolina 74, UALR 62
article.story: PUERTO VALLARTA, Mexico -- Brenton Williams scored 17 points, leading five players in double figures, as South Carolina beat Arkansas-Little Rock 74-62 on Sunday in the Hoops for Hope Classic championship game. Williams was 7 of 7 from the floor. Lakeem Jackson posted a double-double with 10 points, 15 rebounds. LaShay Page scored 16 points, Mindaugas Kacinas 13 and Eric Smith added 10. South Carolina led 39-22 at halftime. In the second half, the Gamecocks continued to dominate. At 13:01, Williams made a 3-pointer to make the game 55-28. The Gamecocks (5-1) shot 56 percent from the field for the game and never trailed. The Trojans (4-3) shot 40 percent. Will Neighbour had 19 points and five rebounds for the Trojans. The Trojans beat SMU 69-56 on Saturday to reach the final. South Carolina defeated Missouri State 74-67 in OT Saturday.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
